channel.title: Random options
channel.description: How do i make it so that my script randomly chooses to do one of two things, I.E. Left click and right click?

item.title: Random options
item.dc:creator: @Cheesehunk Cheesehunk
item.description:
@Cheesehunk wrote:

Good job :), one suggestion. A lot of people make this mistake, even advanced people:

On your Mouse Moving, you move the mosue over the item with random pixels of 3. That is good, but there is one problem: Later you have CMouse(x,y,3,3…) which will also click with a random 3, but the random 3 could be different from the first Mouse Movement.

In order to fix that, so they both end up at the same pixel, but its still random. I do this:

if(FindColorSpiralTolerance(x,y,ColOfFood,560,200,735,465,tol))then
  begin
  x:=x+random(3);
  y:=Y+random(3);
      repeat
       
        MMouse(x,y,0,0);
        if(IsUpText('Eat'))then
        Case Random(2) of
          0: CMouse(x,y,0,0,true);
          1: begin
               CMouse(x,y,0,0,false);
               ClickText('Bury',560,200,735,465);
             end;
        end;
      until(GetHp>EatHpUpTo);
    end;

Now it will still add a random 3, but it is just less detectable because it won’t move after it finds the UpText.

Awesome job by the way, keep it up! I think you have lots of potential.

Read full topic

item.title: Random options
item.dc:creator: @Infintry001 Infintry001
item.description:
@Infintry001 wrote:

ok thanks! look at what i made… it should work lol

{************************************************************************** procedure EatFood(ColOfFood,EatHpAt,EatHpUpTo,tol : integer); by: Infantry001 Description: Eats food until designate hp level. **************************************************************************} Procedure EatFood(ColOfFood,EatHpAt,EatHpUpTo,tol : integer); begin if(GetHp<EatHpAt)then begin GameTab(4); Wait(10+random(20)); if(FindColorSpiralTolerance(x,y,ColOfFood,560,200,735,465,tol))then begin repeat MMouse(x,y,3,3); if(IsUpText('Eat'))then Case Random(2) of 0: CMouse(x,y,3,3,true); 1: begin CMouse(x,y,3,3,false); ClickText('Eat',560,200,735,465); end; end; until(GetHp>EatHpUpTo); end; end; end;

My first procedure! yeys!

Read full topic

item.title: Random options
item.dc:creator: @Cheesehunk Cheesehunk
item.description:
@Cheesehunk wrote:

[quote=“Infintry001, post:5, topic:5810”]how do i make one command use two procedures? as in

Case Random(2) of 0: CMouse(x,y,3,3,true); 1: CMouse(x,y,3,3,false) ClickText('Bury',560,200,735,465); end;[/quote]

Like this?

Case Random(2) of 0: CMouse(x,y,3,3,true); 1: begin CMouse(x,y,3,3,false) ClickText('Bury',560,200,735,465); end; end;

The standars may be a bit messy xD, but that works.

Read full topic

item.title: Random options
item.dc:creator: @King_Keen King Keen
item.description:
@King_Keen wrote:

You can use it for anything really, use your imagination.
Another example.

Case GetTextAt(x, y) of
  'man': writeln('man found.')
  'woman':writeln('woman found.')
end;

The case of command can be used instead of the ‘if then’ command, it helps clear up allot of code and makes it generally easier to read. You can use it for randomly selecting things or for selection things from taking the result of a function.

Read full topic

item.title: Random options
item.dc:creator: @Infintry001 Infintry001
item.description:
@Infintry001 wrote:

thanks so much! Also, what else can you use with a case of command?

Read full topic

item.title: Random options
item.dc:creator: @King_Keen King Keen
item.description:
@King_Keen wrote:

You use the case of command.

Example.

Case Random(2) of 0: ClickMouse(500, 500, true); 1: ClickMouse(500, 500, false); end;

You always need and “end;” at the end of a case of command.

Read full topic
